stems: 3. He tried to include all his notes in the presentation
5. He practiced in front of the mirror
6. He recorded himself with his smartphone
8. He had to wait a long time for his turn to present
data.stimulus:
A student is talking about his experience of making an academic presentation. 

► Read the text and answer the questions below.

Here are some more Presentation Tips. 

► Order the words to make complete sentences.

value: Divide the brief into two sections - the topic and the purpose

possible_responses: Divide the brief into two sections - the topic and the purpose
Divide the brief into two sections - the topic and the key words
Divide the brief into two sections - the topic and the structure
data.stimulus:
Organisation is equally important in presentations and in reports.

► Without a logical structure, your audience will struggle to follow your ideas. 

 

In the report writing lesson, Sania shared some advice on analysing the brief. 

► Can you remember what it was?
data.template:
{{response}}

(if you want to review Sania's advice, watch the video again - click here)

value: Divide the brief into two sections - the topic and the purpose

options.label: The topic is wind power
The topic is wind turbines
The topic is is wind turbine noise

data.stimulus:
Consider the presentation questions below. What is the TOPIC of each one?

 

Presentation Brief 1
Discuss solutions to the problem of wind turbine noise.

options.label: The topic is how wind power is produced
The topic is wind power
The topic is the process of wind power

data.stimulus:
Presentation Brief 2
Describe the process of wind power generation.

options.label: The topic is wind turbines
The topic is how effective wind turbines are
The topic is how effective domestic wind turbines are

data.stimulus:
Presentation Brief 3
Assess the different viewpoints on the effectiveness of domestic wind turbines.

options.label: The topic is clean energy
The topic is wind power
The topic is the cost of wind power

data.stimulus:
Presentation Brief 4
Outline arguments for and against wind energy.

options.label: To make sure you choose the right key words
To make sure you address all parts of the brief
To make sure you focus on the main ideas

data.stimulus:
After you establish the TOPIC of your presentation, you should focus on its PURPOSE, what your lecturer or tutor wants you do in your presentation. 

 

► Why is this important?

Consider the presentation questions we saw in the previous exercises. 

 

► The VERBS show what the purpose of the presentation is.

 

  • Discuss solutions to the problem of wind turbine noise. 
  • Describe the process of wind power generation.
  • Assess the different viewpoints on the effectiveness of domestic wind turbines.
  • Outline arguments for and against wind energy.

 

► Match each of the definitions below with the verbs in the presentation brief.
data.template:
{{response}} To give a summary of something.
{{response}} To give a detailed account in words of something.
{{response}} To say how important, useful or correct something is.
{{response}} To talk or write about something in detail, taking into account different issues or ideas.

value: Describe the process of wind power generation.

possible_responses: Discuss solutions to the problem of wind turbine noise.
Describe the process of wind power generation.
Assess different viewpoints on the effectiveness of domestic wind turbines.
Outline arguments for and against wind energy.
data.stimulus: After analysing the brief carefully, it's time to think about the CONTENT of your presentation and how you will organise it.
data.template:

PLAN:
  • Introduction
  • Definition of wind energy
  • Position of wind turbines
  • Rotation of turbines
  • How power is created
  • How power is stored
  • Conclusion

  • Conclusion

data.stimulus:
Get Ready to Listen

Listen to a student giving one of the presentations. 

► Which presentation brief is it?

value: the energy can be safely stored
the technology behind turbines is cheap
it's cheaper than other energy sources

possible_responses: the energy can be safely stored
it's cheaper than other energy sources
the technology behind turbines is cheap
wind energy is more reliable than solar
data.stimulus:
Listen again and put the Main Points of the presentation in the order they are presented.

 

 

► NOTE: there are some extra options that you don't need

value: the energy can be safely stored
the technology behind turbines is cheap
it's cheaper than other energy sources
benefits of wind energy are not proven on the long term

possible_responses: wind energy should not be our only source
benefits of wind energy are not proven on the long term

value: benefits of wind energy are not proven on the long term
wind energy should not be our only source

possible_responses: wind energy should not be our only source
wind energy has more advantages than disadvantages

value: wind energy should not be our only source

data.stimulus:
You are going to listen to a presentation about...

► Reducing the impact of household waste on the environment.

 

 

Before you listen, predict some vocabulary you might hear. 

► Choose SEVEN from the list below (click on the words to select).

 

(Look up these words in your dictionary if you need to)
data.template: landfill / solar power  / consumerism / biodegradable  / rubbish / industrial waste  / recycled / fossil fuel / decompose / throw_away

options.label: Section by section
Parallel

data.stimulus:
In today's live lesson, your tutor talked about two ways of organising content:

 

 

Listen to the presentation about Household Waste. 

► How does the presenter organise the content?

value: we are throwing away more and there is less space to put it
landfill sites are coming closer to urban areas
we throw away a lot of non‐biodegradable waste

possible_responses: waste products are getting more and more toxic
landfill sites are coming closer to urban areas
we throw away a lot of non‐biodegradable waste
we are throwing away more and there is less space to put it
data.stimulus:
Listen again and put the Main Points of the presentation in the order they are presented.

 

► NOTE: there are some extra options that you don't need

value: we are throwing away more and there is less space to put it
landfill sites are coming closer to urban areas
we throw away a lot of non‐biodegradable waste
use waste as a source of energy
increase the number of collection and processing facilities

possible_responses: use waste as a source of energy
use waste to create new products
increase the number of collection and processing facilities

value: use waste as a source of energy
increase the number of collection and processing facilities
the solutions suggested should be used together

possible_responses: the solutions suggested should be used together
the key solution is to invest in recycling

value: the solutions suggested should be used together
